intro: Piptomeris alata, commonly known as the winged bean, is a tropical legume native to Southeast Asia. It is characterized by its distinctive winged pods, which give it its common name. The plant produces small, yellow flowers that develop into elongated, flat pods containing edible seeds. It is often grown for its high-protein seeds and can thrive in warm, humid climates. The leaves are also edible and are used in various culinary traditions across its native regions.
